en.purpose: To apply standardized Rome IV criteria for diagnosing NBS, ensuring consistency in clinical decision-making and supporting opioid tapering strategies when appropriate.
en.use:
Patients presenting with chronic abdominal pain and a history of opioid use for ≥3 months.

The clinician checks for the presence of the following Rome IV criteria:

Chronic or worsening abdominal pain related to opioid use.

Pain worsens with continued opioid use.

Pain improves with dose reduction or cessation of opioids.

Other gastrointestinal disorders ruled out.
en.misuse:
Do not use for diagnosing opioid withdrawal syndrome.

Not a substitute for clinical judgment, other medical conditions should be ruled out.

other_details.en: A clinical decision support guideline that helps healthcare providers diagnose NBS using Rome IV criteria. The guideline provides a structured approach to assess symptoms, ensuring accurate diagnosis and differentiation from other opioid-related GI conditions.
